quest.name: Warrior of Darkness
journal: The Exarch is looking ahead to the immediate future.
objectives: Speak with Alphinaud in the Crystarium.
Speak with the manager of suites in the Pendants.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Without that constant glare, Lakeland seems an entirely different place...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: It's over, yes? I might need a moment...

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: It's as if the sky itself had disappeared into the heavens... If I didn't have wounded to tend to, I'd never stop staring...

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Now, as for how we proceed from here...

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: The villagers we evacuated earlier have arrived safely in the Crystarium.

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: They seem to be accepting their situation for the moment─most folk are far too distracted by the sky to worry about wounds or lost homes.

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: They whisper and wonder if the Warrior of Darkness has come...

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: 'Tis to be expected.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Forename, I must ask a favor of you. Would you be so kind as to conceal your involvement in this endeavor for the time being?

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Seeing the Light recede from Lakeland is a momentous occasion, and many will be swept up in a maelstrom of excitement and confusion.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Should you come forth as the legendary Warrior of Darkness, I fear that, no matter how good your intentions, such an appearance would throw the city into disarray.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I find myself in agreement with the Exarch, although my concerns are more focused on Eulmore.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: It may be best if you maintain a low profile until we see how Vauthry responds to all of this.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: My thanks. Though we cannot freely celebrate your success, pray allow your heart to be buoyed by the joy of our citizens─a joy you surely brought into being.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Ah, and I must ask the same discretion of you, Captain. 'Tis my intention to share with our people the tale of a great warrior who stood in defiance of the sin eaters. This unnamed champion defeated the Lightwarden, and has since departed for parts unknown, yes?

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: As you wish, my lord. Your penchant for mystery is nothing new, and I will encourage folk not to question this either.

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: ...Although I expect to be told the whole truth of it one day. About all of you.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: With that settled, I shall return to the Crystarium and make an address to the people.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: These explanations and adjustments will consume much of my time, so pray take the opportunity to rest and recover from your exploits. And to think, you'll not even need to shutter the windows to enjoy a dark and peaceful night's sleep!

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: I must stay behind and coordinate the evacuation of the remaining survivors.

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: And I hesitate to ask after all you've done here today, but could I ask you to pass on a message on your way to the Pendants?

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: Please let Bragi know that we're bringing in a number of injured, and that any restoratives in the markets need to be reserved for the infirmary.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We should start making our own way back to the Crystarium─slowly, mind you. It wouldn't do to arrive too soon after the Exarch.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I'm staying behind as well. I... There's something I need to check on in Holminster.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We already went through the village top to bottom, Alisaie. We should all take the chance to rest, you included.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I knew one of those eaters, and I can't just... I can't rest, not now.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: So please, I wish to be left alone for a while. And that means you as well, Forename─I shall be cross if you try to follow me!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I promise to find you later, when I feel myself again.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Hm, just you and me, then. Shall we?

dialogue.name: LYNA
dialogue.text: I'd be grateful if you could pass that message on to Bragi. He should be standing in his usual spot in the markets.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Not to worry, Forename─I've given my address to the citizens, and soothed their most immediate fears.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Your only concern for the moment is recuperating from your victory.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Well, the Crystarium seems relatively ordered, wouldn't you say? The Exarch's speech must have been reassuring to hear.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: On the contrary, there is something jubilant in the air─I have a feeling this night won't be quite as “peaceful” as our hooded friend predicted!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I think I shall take a brief stroll around town before retiring to my chambers. Once you've discharged your duty to Bragi, I suggest you do the same.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Sleep well, Forename. I hope untroubled dreams find you and Alisaie both.

dialogue.name: BRAGI
dialogue.text: Aye, what can I do for you? Looking to buy a lantern, like every other stumbling soul in the city?

dialogue.name: BRAGI
dialogue.text: ...I see. Well Captain Lyna can rest assured that any potions I spot coming in will be set aside for the wounded.

dialogue.name: BRAGI
dialogue.text: Hang on a moment, if you're carrying messages for the guard, does that mean you were there, then? The battle at Holminster?

dialogue.name: BRAGI
dialogue.text: A stalwart lasslad like you might want to pay a visit to the Wandering Stairs, make herselfhimself known...

dialogue.name: BRAGI
dialogue.text: I'm sure Glynard can introduce you to some interesting opportunities.

dialogue.name: BRAGI
dialogue.text: The Wandering Stairs? It's just a short wander up the stairs there, thus the name. Rowdy crowd in attendance this eveningtoday, if that noise is aught to judge by.

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: I need to find me someone with a damn spine...

dialogue.name: LUEREEQ
dialogue.text: I might be able to take Andreia alone, but why take the chance? Never hurts to have someone watching your back when eaters are involved...

dialogue.name: GIOTT
dialogue.text: <gulp> <gulp> <gulp> <burp> Where's that wine I ordered? Do they mean to make me idle here without a drink in hand?

dialogue.name: CERIGG
dialogue.text: Ah, Phronesis, what am I to do? I've not the talents to counter your tricks, but if I could enlist the aid of a seasoned mage...

dialogue.name: GLYNARD
dialogue.text: Cyella, more beer for table two! And a couple of pints of mead for table three, while you're at it!

dialogue.name: CYELLA
dialogue.text: Coming right up!

dialogue.name: GLYNARD
dialogue.text: Sorry, we're rushed off our feet this eveningtoday, misssir. Can I get you anything? Drinks are on the house!

dialogue.name: GLYNARD
dialogue.text: Hm? Oh, that Bragi has a twisted sense of humor...

dialogue.name: GLYNARD
dialogue.text: Gahahaha! To think he'd send you to me at a time like this!

dialogue.name: GLYNARD
dialogue.text: The first real “night” in near a hundred years has folk all riled up and then some!

dialogue.name: GLYNARD
dialogue.text: What's more, there was that eater business at Holminster Switch. They say a Lightwarden was destroyed without a damn trace, and it was the Warrior of Darkness who did the deed!

dialogue.name: CYELLA
dialogue.text: I really must apologize for Glynard─he's been almost as rowdy as our customers, and that's no small feat.

dialogue.name: CYELLA
dialogue.text: A lot of our regulars are bounty hunters, you see. They mostly go after eaters, and the rumor of the Warrior's appearance was the spark to their kindling.

dialogue.name: GLYNARD
dialogue.text: You know how the weak eaters are drawn to the strong ones, right?

dialogue.name: GLYNARD
dialogue.text: Aye, they swarm like angry bees around a queen. You need look no further than Holminster for proof of that. But attacks on that scale don't happen every day, praise the blessed shadow.

dialogue.name: GLYNARD
dialogue.text: No, the more common threats are the strays. No one knows why, but every now and again, an eater will leave the pack to prowl alone. Those are the ones you run into on the road if your luck is foul.

dialogue.name: GLYNARD
dialogue.text: They're a danger to everyone, so the Settlement council puts bounties on their heads. And our bar here is a convenient place for hunters to gather and share information.

dialogue.name: CYELLA
dialogue.text: Seems a few of them were inspired by the Warden-slaying even more than most. These are the types who have their sights set on the absolute worst of the strays─a class of eaters that've been dubbed the “Cardinal Virtues.”

dialogue.name: CYELLA
dialogue.text: The Virtues showed up out of nowhere about three summers ago, and when historians heard the descriptions given by survivors, well...apparently they share an appearance with the villains who caused the Flood.

dialogue.name: CYELLA
dialogue.text: And if that doesn't send a chill down your spine, they're also reported to be as tough as Lightwardens─not the kind of prey you can take down single-handed.

dialogue.name: CYELLA
dialogue.text: Our Virtue-hunters had all but given up, but knowing the Warrior of Darkness is out there has lit a fire in their bellies. Just look at them...

dialogue.name: CYELLA
dialogue.text: That Hume over there with the oversized sword is Granson. He's in it for revenge. Wants to recruit a comrade-in-arms as tenacious as he is.

dialogue.name: CYELLA
dialogue.text: The Mystel lad is Lue-Reeq. Don't be fooled by those dewy cheeks─he's as hard a hunter as they come. He just lost a partner, and seems to be on the lookout for a new one...

dialogue.name: CYELLA
dialogue.text: That's Cerigg. Word is he seeks an expert in magecraft to help fight the Virtue he's after.

dialogue.name: CYELLA
dialogue.text: Last we have Giott, dwarf and drunkard both. Wanted to join forces with a healer, and only a healer. Something about needing a “mender's wisdom”...?

dialogue.name: CYELLA
dialogue.text: I've seen my share of competent veterans, and you have that look about you. Maybe you should introduce yourself to one of our hunters. Who knows? Together you might even collect the bounty on a Cardinal Virtue!

dialogue.name: GLYNARD
dialogue.text: Now there's a grand idea. Imagine the prestige my bar would earn if we boasted the patronage of a successful Virtue-hunter!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have gained access to role quests! A separate quest line and story is now available for tank, physical DPS, magical ranged DPS, and healer roles.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to reach the final stages of the Shadowbringers main scenario, you must complete at least one role quest line. Speak with a Virtue-hunter at the Wandering Stairs to accept a quest offer!

dialogue.name: GLYNARD
dialogue.text: My regulars have their quirks─some more than others─but it's odd how folk can grow on you. Spend enough time with them, and you might become a regular yourself. Always happy to welcome a new addition to the family!

dialogue.name: CYELLA
dialogue.text: Come again whenever you like, our doors are always open...or they would be, if we had any.

dialogue.name: GUIDEOFTHEPENDANTS
dialogue.text: Welcome back, misssir.

dialogue.name: GUIDEOFTHEPENDANTS
dialogue.text: I wonder if anyone can sleep with the city in such an uproar, but will you be retiring to your quarters?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Retire to your quarters?

dialogue.name: GUIDEOFTHEPENDANTS
dialogue.text: Very good. In light─ahem─of the present situation, I have had illumination prepared for all our rooms. No need to rush to the markets for lanterns or candles. Have a pleasant rest, misssir.

obj.n: The Man with Too Many Scars
